comments.body: I don't know if it's possible to play Java edition on chromebook but I agree.

You can already set separate directories per installation, which is the correct solution to this problem

You could set different directories per installation.

However one can't access saves this way.

Example:

  • Play 1.14: Set 1.14 specific options.
  • Play 1.6: (The world is for 1.6 only, but in same saves folder, because you upgraded to 1.14 althroughout)
  • Play 1.14: Options have reverted to 1.6

Solution as described by TwinShards would be a great alternative. However since it wouldn't be compatible with previous versions of the game, the launcher should extract the proper options file to the root folder. However this may all be too complicated and this problem should be tackled differently, possibly from in-game, with limited support for 1.14+
This is not a launcher suggestion.

Haven't been checking it in a while...

Replying to ↑ just the comment above: It is a launcher suggestion. When the game launch... what extract saves, mods, texturepack, and options? The launcher does all that.

*Also you are right tryashtar but this can be very complicated for many many peoples.

And i haven't mention that you can not conjoint-link the server list file to one singular place.

As soon i attempted that the game made remade the server list in his own folder instead of using the conjoint-linked file.

This NEEDS to be a thing. There is no reason why there isn't at least a simple URL that takes you to FindMCServer on the home page of the launcher, and/or across the top of the Java Edition and Bedrock Edition pages. Mojang aren't opposed to linking to third-party sites - they used to have a link to the Minecraft Forums on previous versions of the launcher, and they have a link to NameMC to this day (in Settings -> About). They have also announced the birth and 1-year anniversary of FindMCServer in the launcher already.

A simple link to FindMCServer would surely make it blow all the other pay-to-win server lists out of the water in terms of traffic. This would benefit both server owners and players, from both gameplay and safety/practical standpoints.

UP-VOTE THIS POST!!!

Been saying this for over a year.. Findmcserver could be HUGE for small servers that don't engage in the same manner of predatory marketing strategies or have a massive budget for advertising. The Minecraft server industry is very top heavy, and this badly affects the player experience because players have a hard time finding "their" server. Any server listing site you visit other than Findmcserver, you will see the same servers listed on the site, because they all pay huge monthly premiums to be listed there. Unfortunately Findmcserver's SEO is not strong enough to beat them, nor does it have the budget to do so considering it's (mostly) a free service.
Please Mojang, Gamersafer has done an amazing job building a safe, EULA compliant, and family friendly community to showcase high quality servers to a wider audience. Please help them out. That one week shoutout they got in the launcher, and a single tweet several months ago, is simply not enough to promote this great service.

I think that this would be massive for server discovery and would do wonders at damaging the server list slot selling business that hurts the minecraft community at a whole as the same few server are the ones that can buy their way to more players. Launcher is perfect for this especially if Mojang feels like they can't modify the multiplayer screen on java due to it being really old or something like that. If they are willing to put a minecraft movie promo in the launcher I don't think they think its sacred enough to not touch for new stuff like this. Also this would perfectly integrate into the quickplay system they made relatively recently. The server list could be a tab on the java launcher and it would then pull the list from the gamer safer list basically from the internet. Then when you clicked on a server to join it could pull the IP from the website and boot up minecraft immediately joining the server. Maybe like in the UI for the list there could be a "Join Server With Profile" selector thing so that you could select a profile like the MC version to join the server with. Then if you press the button and boot up minecraft to join the server, it could then add the server to your server list. This would help like if you have the wrong version or for some reason can't join the server as you wouldn't want to go back to the launcher for that. In addition, the IP should be visible in the list as well. But that's all the fancy stuff that's possible if you integrate it.

I put this in the gamersafer discord, but figured I would copy it here. The launcher is perfect for this especially if Mojang feels like they can't modify the multiplayer screen on java due to it being really old or something like that. This would perfectly integrate into the quickplay system they made relatively recently. The server list could be a tab on the java launcher and it would then pull the list from the gamer safer list basically from the internet. Then when you clicked on a server to join it could pull the IP from the website and boot up Minecraft immediately joining the server. Maybe like in the UI for the list there could be a "Join Server With Profile" selector thing so that you could select a profile like the MC version to join the server with. Then if you press the button and boot up minecraft to join the server, it could then add the server to your server list. This would help like if you have the wrong version or for some reason can't join the server as you wouldn't want to go back to the launcher for that. In addition, the IP should be visible in the list as well. But that's all the fancy stuff that's possible if you integrate it in the launcher. The easiest thing they could do to drive traffic to the official server list is just have a tab in the launcher that says Server list and basically says "here is a link to the official server list".
Hide and disable default skins needed. Especially for offline

I don't like to see the default skins when I have the custom ones that I created. Imagine making more than 10 skins, and seeing the default ones. This could generally take up the whole screen, with skins that you don't need, because you have your own or generally community made skins that you use instead. I would be really happy if this will be added.

This could be great to prevent authoritarian/abusive parents from randomly deleting their child's worlds with no reason. This happened on Reddit (I'm not posting the link) when a 9-yr-old's father deleted his son's with no prior warning. When he realized, he sobbed and cried for the rest of the day.

Yes please. I don't want my 5 year old nephew on my redstone worlds when he plays on our iPad. Consoles like Playstation and Xbox have different user accounts, preventing one user from accessing another account's worlds. But mobile devices don't have this. Even when you sign out of your microsoft account, your worlds are still accessible, so a password to protect then would be a great addition I think.
Not merely Fedora, but openSUSE too.
I agree. I have been using prism launcher but I wanted to have the regular minecraft launcher as well for my own reasons. Disappointing that this remains unaddressed.
I'm also a Fedora user, and I support this request from the community. This is very important for players who use Linux and play Minecraft.
I need this too.

It's already accessible
Offline Launcher + offline skins are an absolute need for those who don't have 24/7 access to the internet.

It should be fully possible to install, launch, and play Minecraft without ever connecting that device to the internet.

I have a new PC that is deliberately not internet-capable, to reduce distractions and increase productivity.  I want a limited number of games there, including oldschool Minecraft.

I bought Minecraft long before Microsoft bought it, yet I have to go get a hall pass from Microsoft to be able to play the game I own?  This is ridiculous, bad for slow internet users, and, frankly, offensive.

I suggest:

  1. A launcher that only has pre-Microsoft versions, and no DRM/authentication
  2. Updating the main launcher to include a fully-offline mode for all but the latest versions

Both available on the main site if you paid for Minecraft.

Providing an installer for the pre-Microsoft versions allows unrestricted access to players like me who bought in early, and surely Microsoft's bottom line isn't threatened by unauthorized users possibly getting their hands on that set of Minecraft builds.

Providing full offline access (no authentication step) for most versions (e.g. minus the most recent 2-4 full versions) should be doable if the player already has the version files.  I install the versions on my main computer, then transfer the files to my new PC, and the game recognizes that hey, here's the files, let's get gaming.  (Ideally LAN also.)

You could figure out a way to provide offline-only access for newer versions, but they don't concern me as much (I mostly want my fave, 1.7.10).
you can do that
This will be so cool!

this is already possible in the launcher just go to settings, scroll down to "Minecraft: Java Edition Settings" and click on "Show Historical versions of Minecraft: Java Edition in the Launcher" and then you can play beta and then when you make a new installation you can scroll down and click on older versions
That's basically what happens on Minecraft.net, they feature artwork and allow the community to see.

I really hope this would get added, downloading custom skins and then posting them is a bit like a chore, adding a skin editor and a preview would save so much time. There should also be a download option if you wanted to download the skin png.

I agree.  It's pointless to have the news on the main page when there's a link for News in the left sidebar.  I actually thought that the launcher was broken/not rendering correctly when I saw the news below the PLAY button. Terrible UI design.

I agree! I was gonna write a post like this and then it took me to yours! This is an amazing idea and I'm aware we wouldn't be able to do this on mobile and console, but for PC users this would be a fun nostalgia trip. Thanks for sharing this to Mojang.

This would be cool. Minecraft already runs well enough on my mac now, but it would be cool to see how much faster it would run in game mode.

From my understanding of Apple's documentation Game Mode should enable any time a game is in full screen, whether that's done through the green button or through a full screen option in the game's menu.

I'd love for this feature to be enabled, it's great in other games.

2024 UPDATE: It seems to be working on my MacBook. You just have to click the full screen button on the Java application. Make sure you are updated to the latest macOS and Minecraft version before you test it out.
